Key Match Events: Shaheen Shah Afridi took Pakistan over the line with a couple of sixes in the 19th over as the Green Shirts closed their T20 World Cup run with a three-wicket win.
Afridi was declared the Player of the Match for his crucial 13-run addition at the end and his 22-3 in the four overs earlier in the match.
Barry McCarthy was the pick of the bowlers for Ireland with his impressive 15-3 figures.
Usman Khan and Shadab Khan were both dismissed by Barry McCarthy in his third over, putting the brakes on the run chase.
Fakhar Zaman got caught at mid-off on the first ball of the ninth over.
Mohammad Rizwan got caught off his signature shot in the deep in the sixth over.
Saim Ayub got caught behind off a leading edge in the fifth over.
Imad Wasim got a wicket with a collision in the deep as Shaheen Shah Afridi held on to the catch, dismissing Mark Adair in the 14th over.
Barry McCarthy was clean-bowled by Imad Wasim, leaving Ireland 86-9 after 15 overs.
Gareth Delany was caught at point off a leading edge in the 12th over.
Curtis Campher was caught in the field by Saim Ayub after being beaten for pace by Haris Rauf.
George Dockrell was caught and bowled by Mohammad Amir with a slower delivery.
Harry Tector was dismissed by Shaheen Shah Afridi's swing and pace.
Paul Stirling was caught behind off Mohammad Amir.
Andrew Balbirnie and Lorcan Tucker were both dismissed by Shaheen Shah Afridi in the first over.
Pre-Game Insights: Pakistan won the toss and decided to bowl first against Ireland in their farewell match of the T20 World Cup 2024.
Captain Babar Azam said the decision is based on the ground conditions in Florida where it has not rained today, but the pitch has been under covers for three days.
Ramiz Raja shared that even though there is no rain, the outfield is still quite wet.
Waqar Younis said that the groundstaff have done well to prepare the pitch, which has a few green spots that will help the pacers.
The pitch is a bit damp and soft which will make things difficult for the batters, adding that whoever wins the toss should look to bowl first.
Irish skipper Paul Stirling maintained that he would have liked to bowl first as well and will now look to put up runs on the board.
Paul Stirling added, 'Ireland managed to beat Pakistan leading up to the World Cup and did not go on to win the series, but this is a World Cup game and the feeling is different.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Batting conditions after rain-hit Florida proved to be quite tricky as Pakistani pacers along with Imad Wasim dominated the first half.
